stream_context.summary: Kaze codes live on the Monty Mole hide-out inside the new cowboy course, building a small "boss" encounter (five Monty Moles that pop from random holes and throw rocks) while showing off a freshly written custom collision engine.

development_findings.summary: A brand-new collision engine has replaced Mario 64’s original system, eliminating most sticking issues and handling tight spaces reliably.
development_findings.quote: I made a completely new collision system… We could even go into a shit thing like this and not get stuck. It literally just works.

development_findings.summary: The new collision unintentionally killed BLJ; Kaze wants to restore BLJ because it’s a deliberate, opt-in glitch.
development_findings.quote: I’m not trying to prevent the BLJ… If there’s a bug you only encounter on purpose, I’ll leave it in the game.

development_findings.summary: Monty Mole boss design: five moles emerge from random holes, throw rocks that deal 2 HP, and drop 1–2 coins when stomped; player must defeat all to earn the star.
Projectile math: Kaze derived an initial Y-velocity formula (after ChatGPT failed) so each rock lands exactly on Mario’s current position; Mario’s future velocity is ignored.
development_findings.quote: It’s not predictive. It shoots exactly where Mario is at.

development_findings.summary: Memory limits forced removal of bridge collision in the cowboy level and motivate careful object counts.
development_findings.quote: I had to remove the collision here for RAM reasons for now.

development_findings.summary: Project scope update: three main courses, two side levels, and one Bowser stage remain; Kaze estimates ~80 % complete.
development_findings.quote: We’re like 80 % of the way there.

development_findings.summary: After releasing Return to Yoshi’s Island, Kaze plans a Kickstarter for an original 3-D platformer (likely late-N64/early-GC aesthetic).
development_findings.quote: Alongside the release … I’ll probably launch a Kickstarter for my own game and then transition to working on that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is 40 days into a weight-cut, down ~6.5 kg and feeling ‘chiseled’.
He values freedom and sees adulthood with income as preferable to school; views high-school nostalgia skeptically.
Critical-feedback philosophy: he focuses on the emotion behind a complaint, not the literal wording, because critics often confuse metrics with feelings.
context_findings.quote: Whenever I receive criticism… I try to look at the underlying feeling.

context_findings.summary: Sponsor anecdote: a handheld maker offered a small fee; Kaze delivered a sarcastic ad, sponsors were upset, he ignored them.
context_findings.quote: You’re offering me a $150 device… usually for an ad you get like $3,000. Yeah, no way.

zeina.summary: Zeina (animator, Kaze’s spouse) was absent; Kaze joked that she still hasn’t finished quaternion animations and might send him to a labor camp if he doesn’t fund them.
zeina.quote: Lila will only vote for you if you promise that you will force a few programmers to finish quaternion animations.

key_stories.title: Replacing Mario 64 Collision
key_stories.summary: Fed up with the original engine’s edge-snagging, Kaze rewrote collision from scratch and demoed flawless movement in tight crevices.
key_stories.challenge: Original SM64 collision caused sticking and instability, limiting level design.
key_stories.process: Implemented a bespoke collision detection and response system; live-tested in glitch-prone spots.
key_stories.outcome: Stable traversal everywhere, but BLJ currently disabled; intends to re-enable where intentional.
key_stories.key_quote: Look at this… It literally just works, even in fucked-up spots like this.

key_stories.title: Figuring Out Rock Physics
key_stories.summary: Needed rocks from Monty Moles to land precisely on Mario regardless of height differences.
key_stories.challenge: Derive correct initial Y-velocity with gravity for arbitrary delta-Y.
key_stories.process: Tried ChatGPT, rejected its answers, hand-derived sum-of-frames formula and implemented it.
key_stories.outcome: Rocks now hit target; later clamped minimum speed for gameplay feel.
key_stories.key_quote: ChatGPT is not being useful here; let’s just make up bullshit until it works.

key_stories.title: Sponsor Ad Backfires
key_stories.summary: Accepted a handheld emulator for an ad; produced a tongue-in-cheek spot calling it a ‘Chinese scam’.
key_stories.challenge: Low compensation and product’s legal gray area.
key_stories.outcome: Company became ‘very angry’; Kaze ignored further emails.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I gave them an awesome ad… They were so mad at me.
